Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: நாண்என்னும் நல்லாள் புறங்கொடுக்கும் கள்ளென்னும் பேணாப் பெருங்குற்றத் தார்க்கு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The fair maid of modesty will turn her back on those who are guilty of the great and abominable crime of drunkenness.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is shown embracing the great crime of drunkenness ('கள் என்னும் பெருங்குற்றம்'). They are happily drinking from a large jug of wine.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Behind them, the virtue of Modesty or Shamefacedness is personified as a beautiful, noble maiden ('நாண் என்னும் நல்லாள்').
Layered_Composition.Background: Seeing the person commit this un-cherishable crime, the maiden of Modesty is shown turning her back in disgust ('புறங்கொடுக்கும்') and walking away, abandoning the drunkard forever.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The good maiden of Modesty will turn her back and abandon anyone who commits the great crime of drunkenness.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The personification of Modesty as a noble maiden is key. The act of her physically turning her back and leaving is a powerful metaphor for the drunkard's loss of all shame.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Abandonment, shamelessness, a loss of virtue.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The drunkard is in a dim, sordid light. The maiden of Modesty is initially surrounded by a pure, white light, which she takes with her as she leaves, plunging the drunkard into a deeper moral darkness.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that shows the drunkard in the foreground and the departing maiden of Modesty in the background.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Dynamic lighting that changes as the maiden departs.
